-N63ZWU1nm9U7q7SOEMH.name: Astalagans Blessing. Aidron and the characters each regain (1d4+4) hit points as the bronze light surrounds them with warmth.

tableitems.name: Astalagans Blessing. Aidron and the characters each regain (1d4+4) hit points as the bronze light surrounds them with warmth.
Clyssavars Flames. Sparkrender must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 7 (2d6) fire damage as the golden light crashes into him.
Eldenemirs Gift. Sparkrenders Breath Weapon recharges as the blue light enfolds him.
Sharruths Fury. Each of the characters must suceed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or take 3 (1d6) fire damage as the red light erupts with fire.
Turadaers Tricks. Aidron and the characters gain advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until initiative count 0 of the next round, as the brass light shimmers and sparks around them.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7rgpUzB8LHq7ZjEpWE_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Cost 10 gp 
Weight 6 lb  This shield is made of wood or metal. Equipping it requires an action. While equipped, the shield increases your AC by 2 if you have shield proficiency. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7rhgL7cy9BZGP9t8UB_itemcontent
attribs.current: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7rhyMEo3yD8t4CWvKC_itemcontent
attribs.current: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7ri7fUg98-sxx95XfX_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Cost 5 sp
Weight 1 lb  This container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torchor anything else with abundant, exposed fueltakes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7riB-YdkJZ7W99lgjL_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Cost 1 cp
Weight 1 lb  This torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7riB-YdkJZ7W99lgjL_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/40

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7riMcO5nBZATUyqQAx_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Cost 5 sp
Weight 2 lb  These rations are enough for one person for one day and include jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7riS1WGpkOkM5kwV3v_itemcontent
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7rippYXbIuxYWjPTG3_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Cost 1 gp
Weight 10 lb  This rope is 50 feet long, has 2 hit points, and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7rjDA55ECwK0jt3pvc_itemname
attribs.current: Broken blade taken as a trophy from a fallen enemy

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7rjfKyoW7cDRrLsWY2_itemcontent
attribs.current: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch. A pouch can hold up to 1/5 cubic foot or 6 pounds of gear.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N7rkdUwgILT9WhbvZDl_spelldescription
attribs.current: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N7rkdUwgILT9WhbvZDl_spelltarget
attribs.current: up to three creatures within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N7rkgfZKh5AXpPL0Nt7_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on Undead or Constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-N7vZvQw8pRV7LAoYzXv_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.
If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-N7vZvQw8pRV7LAoYzXv_spelltarget
attribs.current: One object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-N7vZyIwnHDx3fHsDVlV_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.
The spells damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-N7va038LGAYwaUeDhb1_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You manifest a minor wonder, a sign of supernatural power, within range. You create one of the following magical effects within range:
Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.
You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7vnu1wkDYwWy4PXGfu_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Armor  Armor Class (AC)  Strength  Stealth  Cost  WeightHeavy Armor (10 minutes to don and 5 minutes to doff)
Chain mail
16
Str 13
Disadvantage
75 gp
55 lb

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-N7vnu1wkDYwWy4PXGfu_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Heavy Armor, AC: 16, Stealth:Disadvantage

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81tP7yGMTdx33P8e5N_description
attribs.current: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness in that radius as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81u1EsdU3FA6uFSMcW_description
attribs.current: You have resistance to poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the poisoned condition on yourself.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81uB9DLTUbtzu98CDZ_description
attribs.current: When you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus (so you roll a d20 + 4 for the check.)

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81uZKW9R5AyenbMs4X_description
attribs.current: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level (included in your hit points).

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81uh0VQqXdi0bLnhas_description
attribs.current: Your speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81v4Zbk9qPU7MuJxtF_description
attribs.current: You draw magic from a divine domaina sphere of magical influenceassociated with your deity. Your domain is Life. This domain gives you features elsewhere on the character sheet.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81vmXnbwku5xeCCEmT_description
attribs.current: Each time you finish a long rest, you can prepare four 1st-level spells to make them available for you to cast, choosing from the 1st-level spells listed in the Cleric Spell List on the Bio & Info tab of this sheet. In addition to those four, you always have these two spells prepared, thanks to the Life Domain: bless and cure wounds.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81wATTjzXONz2myD6b_description
attribs.current:
You have two 1st-level spell slots you can use to cast your prepared spells. You can use them to cast two different spells or to cast the same spell twice. You regain your expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You can keep track of your expended spell slots by decreasing the number in the Slots Remaining box of the Spells section of this character sheet.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81wl0XQGjVQG2vN3jI_description
attribs.current: You know a few cantrips, which are spells you cast without expending spell slots. You know the following cantrips, each of which is detailed in the rulebook: light, sacred flame, and thaumaturgy.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81wxn1W-ZTAM06g1Ed_description
attribs.current: When a creature makes a saving throw to resist one of your spells, the DC of the saving throw is 13. When you make a spell attack, you roll 1d20 + 5 to see if you hit. These numbers are based on your spellcasting ability, which is Wisdom.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81xEuVV3ZhE5JTxHrZ_description
attribs.current: You can cast a cleric spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared. The rulebook explains rituals.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-N81xM0535SVHKTPCuZQ_description
attribs.current: Thanks to the Life Domain, your healing spells are particularly effective. Whenever you restore hit points to a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-N81yi9xdeT5TdV5NZOr_name
attribs.current: all simple weapons, battleaxes, and warhammers

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HLDLh86MHcVeORWi_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HLDLh86MHcVeORWi_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is Undead, if it doesnt understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.
Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target cant follow your command, the spell ends.
Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.
Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.
Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.
Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.
Halt. The target doesnt move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HLDLh86MHcVeORWi_spelltarget
attribs.current: a creature you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HNwveQzzx7YgRWtS_spelldescription
attribs.current:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HQiLjDn4Jpk26WxP_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HQiLjDn4Jpk26WxP_spelldescription
attribs.current: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HQiLjDn4Jpk26WxP_spelltarget
attribs.current: a creature of your choice within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HRvwxxMZvEFuoovj_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HRvwxxMZvEFuoovj_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on Undead or Constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HRvwxxMZvEFuoovj_spelltarget
attribs.current: a creature of your choice that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HUw4JmQpSlUcK74M_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HUw4JmQpSlUcK74M_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: Aberrations, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead.
The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also cant be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HW3d8i6xPu1bXTKg_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesnt protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.
If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HXUxusvqmHcaVk8b_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: a small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HXUxusvqmHcaVk8b_spelldescription
attribs.current: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-N82HXUxusvqmHcaVk8b_spelltarget
attribs.current: a creature of your choice within range
